page.title: 17HARLOW CYCLE MUSEUM .
page.content: Mr.John Collins' bicycle collection forms the core of{Harlow Bicycle {Museum .}It was opened in{1982}in the former stables of Mark Hall mansion. Inside are five galleries which each show a different aspect of bicycle history.Outside,{the Gardens}have been replanned and people can sit there in tranquility.Here are some of our thoughts about the Museum . "The Hedges boneshaker bike looked very bumpy and uncomfortable to ride." "The Penny Farthing was too high up ." "I wouldnt be able to ride it because I couldnt reach the pedals ." "The plastic bike looks as if it would fall apart as you ride it ." "I could rest if I were on the back seat of the tandem ." "The gardens were peaceful,I'm going to take my Gran ." "They look different from our bikes!"
